result.execSummary:
The defendant Howard J. Beech was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Howard J. Beech is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Howard J. Beech was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Howard J. Beech was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any sentence presently being served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
** Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).
** Pay restitution plus surcharge.  May Not have contact with victim.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft while on probation.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA James Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared via telephone.  Atty Thomas Aquino appeared via telephone.  Atty Aquino moves to w/draw as appellate counsel.  Discussion held.  Deft has no objection to the motion to w/draw.  Court grants Atty Aquino's motion to w/draw.

1106  Clerk HM.   Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.   DE appears by phone and with Atty Watson.  No appearance by victim.   Victim has not sent any documentation to the state supporting his claim for restitution.  Atty Watson requests restitution be set at zero.  So ordered.

Dated 4/11/16 - IT IS ORDERED that the time for filing a notice of intent to pursue postconviction relief is extended to April 6, 2016.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the time to act commences as of the date of this order.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  DDA Graveley appeared for the State.  Deft appeared via telephone.  Atty Watson appeared in person.  Case brought to court today pursuant to a letter which was received from DOC requesting clarification on the probationary term on count 4.  Brief discussion held.  State moves to dismiss the repeater allegation on count 4.  Defense counsel will speak with the deft regarding this proposal.  If all parties are in agreement, the attys may submit a written stipulation w/in 15 days.  If not agreed upon, another hrg will be held.

Notice faxed to State Public Defender's Office 9/6/15.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  DDA Graveley appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Kristyne Watson.  Victim rights compliance.  Victim present; statement made.  Sentencing arguments made.  Count 2 - deft sentenced to 8yrs WSP consecutive to any sentence presently being served; initial confinement of 5yrs followed by 3yrs of ES.  See conditions.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.  Count 4 - sentence w/held; placed on probation for 7-1/2 yrs consecutive to count 2.  See conditions.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.  Restitution hrg is requested.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgment.
